meanings.definition: Difficult to hold onto or stand on because of being smooth, wet, icy, etc.
meanings.sent1: The floor was so slippery after the rain that I almost fell.
meanings.sent2: Be careful on the icy sidewalk; it's very slippery.
meanings.sent3: The slippery banana peel caused a hilarious fall in the comedy show.
meanings.sent4: Navigating through the crowded market was like walking on a slippery slope.
meanings.sent5: The slippery surface of the slide made the children squeal with delight.

meanings.definition: Not to be trusted or relied on.
meanings.sent1: He is known for his slippery ways of avoiding responsibility.
meanings.sent2: The salesman's promises turned out to be as slippery as an eel.
meanings.sent3: The slippery excuse he gave for being late was unbelievable.
meanings.sent4: Her argument was as slippery as a fish trying to escape a net.
meanings.sent5: The politician's slippery behavior made the public lose trust in him.
